The alignment of Mercury: Venus, and Saturn with the Pyramids of Giza on December 3, 2012, as claimed in the photo.
The use of a reverse image search: which led to the discovery that the image was created using a free online program called Stellarium.
Expert opinions stating that the image d: as the alignment depicted would not be visible from Giza when looking north at the horizon.
The use of an astronomy simulation tool: Solar System Scope, to compare the alignment of the three planets in the Egyptian sky on December 3, 2012, which confirmed that the photo was impossible and did not match the actual alignment of the planets.
